description: Unique identifier for a person's exposure to a foreign physical object or instrument.
comment: Primary Key for the DEVICE_EXPOSURE table.

description: Unique identifier for the person associated with the device exposure.
Standard concept mapped from the source concept ID representing the foreign object or instrument.
Start date of the device exposure, e.g., implantation, prescription, or administration.
comment: Start date of the device exposure.

description: Start datetime of the device exposure. Convention is to set time to midnight if unavailable.
comment: Start datetime of the device exposure.

description: End date of the device exposure, if available.
comment: End date or discontinuation date of the device exposure.

description: End datetime of the device exposure. Convention is to set time to midnight if unavailable.
comment: End datetime of the device exposure.

description: Concept ID representing the provenance of the device record (e.g., claims, EHR).
Unique Device Identification (UDI-DI) number for FDA-regulated devices, if available.
Production Identifier (UDI-PI) portion of the Unique Device Identification.
Quantity of device exposure. Defaults to 1 if omitted in the source data.
Provider associated with the device exposure (e.g., prescribing or implanting provider).
Visit during which the device was prescribed or given.
Visit Detail during which the device was prescribed or given.
Verbatim value from the source data representing the device exposure.
Concept ID representing the device source value, not necessarily standard.
Concept ID representing the unit of the device (e.g., mL for blood transfusions).
Verbatim value from the source data representing the unit of the device.
comment: Source-provided unit value for the device.

description: Concept ID representing the unit source value, not necessarily standard.
